learning_outcomes.description: Identify and define key components of operating systems such as the kernel, process management, memory management, and file systems.
Explain the role and functionality of operating systems in managing hardware and software resources and how software interacts with hardware.
Create and apply design decisions for low-level operating systems components at the kernel and device driver level.
Analyse the performance and trade-offs of operating system components like schedulers or file systems.
Evaluate security features and vulnerabilities of operating systems and propose improvements or alternatives.
Design a simple operating system module or enhance an existing module, such as a scheduler or a file system, using appropriate programming tools and environments.

assessments.due_date:
19/08/2024 3:00 pm

You will demonstrate your assignment using the code submitted for that stage during the lab session in the week it is due.
assessments.category: Computer Code, Practical/ Demonstration, Quiz, Reflection
assessments.task_description: Each programming assignment will require students to implement a systems programming exercise in C. Students will work individually on assignments.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All assignment-related code must be submitted to the student's code repository by the due date. The code must be submitted using git push. A Git commit is not a submission as it does not send the code to the student’s online repository. Any other assignment-related assessment items must be submitted to Black Board.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(22 Jul - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Weekly Lectures

Weekly lectures will provide the theoretical foundation for the course material. Lecture slides are provided on the course BlackBoard site.
learning_activities.topic_description: Weekly Lectures Weekly lectures will provide the theoretical foundation for the course material. Lecture slides are provided on the course BlackBoard site.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 12(22 Jul - 20 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Weekly Contact Session

The weekly contact session will present content related to the practicals and assignments, and revise lecture material through revision questions.
learning_activities.topic_description: Weekly Contact Session The weekly contact session will present content related to the practicals and assignments, and revise lecture material through revision questions.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 8(22 Jul - 15 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
Weekly Practicals

Students should sign-on to one scheduled weekly practical session. The weekly practical sessions will be on-campus and will provide an opportunity to work through a set of staged exercises which provide students with the necessary skills to undertake the programming assignments.
